We specialize in collecting and analyzing primary data across Nigeria, empowering businesses with actionable insights to thrive in an ever-evolving market landscape.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Graphics Designer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Requirements


	2-3 years of working Experience.
	Proficient in Photoshop
	Adobe Ilustrator
	Logo Design
	Proper Understanding of colors.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment@oaksintelligence.co&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Graphics Designer Job at Oaks Intelligence Limited




        
    

        
        Oaks Intelligence Limited is a leading data and software company dedicated to developing bespoke web, mobile, and desktop applications. We specialize in collecting and analyzing primary data across Nigeria, empowering businesses with actionable insights to thrive in an ever-evolving market landscape.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graphics Designer

Job Location: Lagos

Requirements
     

            
    




	2-3 years of working Experience.
	Proficient in Photoshop
	Adobe Ilustrator
	Logo Design
	Proper Understanding of colors.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@oaksintelligence.co using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Content Creator",
  "description": "Fidelam Homes Limited is a real estate development company incorporated in Nigeria and located in the federal capital territory. At Fidelam homes we believe in integrity, commitment to excellence, a professional attitude and personalized care.&nbsp;We take pride in our exception architectural and modern home designs while keeping in mind affordability.&nbsp;Customer care is one of our strongest priority as we value our clients and provide bespoke service you deserve.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Content Creator

Job Location:&nbsp;Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Content Ideation and Strategy: Brainstorming new and creative content ideas based on audience research, industry trends, and brand goals. This involves developing a content calendar and planning what to create and when.
	Content Production: This is the core duty and can include a wide range of formats:
	
		Writing: Crafting blog posts, articles, website copy, newsletters, emails, and social media captions.
		Visual Media: Creating graphics, infographics, and other visual assets.
		Video and Audio: Filming, recording, and editing videos (vlogs, short-form content) or podcasts.
	
	
	Editing and Proofreading: Polishing all content for accuracy, grammar, style, and tone to ensure it is high-quality and consistent with the brand&#39;s voice.
	SEO Optimization: Implementing basic Search Engine Optimization (SEO) principles, such as keyword research, to ensure content is discoverable by search engines.
	Collaboration: Working with other teams, like marketing, design, and SEO specialists, to ensure content aligns with overall business objectives.
	Audience Engagement: Responding to comments, messages, and questions on social media and other platforms to foster a sense of community.
	Research: Staying up-to-date on industry news, trends, and competitor content to ensure their work remains relevant and competitive.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor&#39;s Degree / HND qualification with at least 2 years of work experience.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;ElizabethKolawole@fidelamhomes.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",
  "datePosted": "2025-08-25",
  "validThrough": "2025-09-11",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",

  },

Content Creator Job at Fidelam Homes Limited




        
    

        
        Fidelam Homes Limited is a real estate development company incorporated in Nigeria and located in the federal capital territory. At Fidelam homes we believe in integrity, commitment to excellence, a professional attitude and personalized care. We take pride in our exception architectural and modern home designs while keeping in mind affordability. Customer care is one of our strongest priority as we value our clients and provide bespoke service you deserve.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Content Creator

Job Location: Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Content Ideation and Strategy: Brainstorming new and creative content ideas based on audience research, industry trends, and brand goals. This involves developing a content calendar and planning what to create and when.
	Content Production: This is the core duty and can include a wide range of formats:
	
		Writing: Crafting blog posts, articles, website copy, newsletters, emails, and social media captions.
		Visual Media: Creating graphics, infographics, and other visual assets.
		Video and Audio: Filming, recording, and editing videos (vlogs, short-form content) or podcasts.
	
	
	Editing and Proofreading: Polishing all content for accuracy, grammar, style, and tone to ensure it is high-quality and consistent with the brand's voice.
	SEO Optimization: Implementing basic Search Engine Optimization (SEO) principles, such as keyword research, to ensure content is discoverable by search engines.
	Collaboration: Working with other teams, like marketing, design, and SEO specialists, to ensure content aligns with overall business objectives.
	Audience Engagement: Responding to comments, messages, and questions on social media and other platforms to foster a sense of community.
	Research: Staying up-to-date on industry news, trends, and competitor content to ensure their work remains relevant and competitive.


Requirements


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree / HND qualification with at least 2 years of work experience.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: ElizabethKolawole@fidelamhomes.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Social Media Marketer (Content Creation & Management) PPA",
  "description": "OPPO is one of the world&rsquo;s leading innovators in smart devices and mobile technology. With operations in over 60 countries and regions, OPPO is dedicated to delivering cutting-edge innovation, premium user experiences, and stylish designs. In Nigeria, OPPO continues to expand its footprint with over 290,000 points of sale and 1,900 official service centers&mdash;bringing the beauty of technology closer to people every day.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Marketer (Content Creation &amp; Management) PPA

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos&nbsp;
Employment Type: NYSC

Job Description
We are looking for passionate and creative Social Media Marketers to join our team. The ideal candidates must be able to:


	Create engaging and high-quality content for social media platforms.
	Manage and grow the company&rsquo;s social media handles.
	Handle a camera confidently for photoshoots and video recording.
	Edit videos and pictures professionally for online content.


Requirements


	Must currently be serving NYSC and looking for a PPA (Place of Primary Assignment).
	Prior experience in social media marketing, content creation, and media handling is preferred.
	Proximity to Ogba, Lagos is highly preferred.
	Passion for social media, creativity, and consistency is a must.


Remuneration
N60,000 - N80,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;cvpool2021@oppo-aed.ng&nbsp;using &ldquo;Application &ndash; Social Media Marketer(PPA)&rdquo; as the subject of the mail.

Note:&nbsp;Only interested and qualified candidates will be contacted.",
  "datePosted": "2025-08-25",
  "validThrough": "2025-09-18",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "OPPO"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",

Social Media Marketer (Content Creation & Management) PPA Job at OPPO




        
    

        
        OPPO is one of the world’s leading innovators in smart devices and mobile technology. With operations in over 60 countries and regions, OPPO is dedicated to delivering cutting-edge innovation, premium user experiences, and stylish designs. In Nigeria, OPPO continues to expand its footprint with over 290,000 points of sale and 1,900 official service centers—bringing the beauty of technology closer to people every day.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Social Media Marketer (Content Creation & Management) PPA

Job Location: Lagos 
Employment Type: NYSC
     

            
    



Job Description
We are looking for passionate and creative Social Media Marketers to join our team. The ideal candidates must be able to:


	Create engaging and high-quality content for social media platforms.
	Manage and grow the company’s social media handles.
	Handle a camera confidently for photoshoots and video recording.
	Edit videos and pictures professionally for online content.


Requirements


	Must currently be serving NYSC and looking for a PPA (Place of Primary Assignment).
	Prior experience in social media marketing, content creation, and media handling is preferred.
	Proximity to Ogba, Lagos is highly preferred.
	Passion for social media, creativity, and consistency is a must.


Remuneration
N60,000 - N80,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: cvpool2021@oppo-aed.ng using “Application – Social Media Marketer(PPA)” as the subject of the mail.

Note: Only interested and qualified candidates will be contacted.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "description": "Soft Alliance is a highly-driven organization, motivated to help businesses run efficient processes and deliver services effectively. For over sixteen (16) years, we have delivered high-end IT services to many organizations. Through our diverse experience and expertise, we have led the largest ERP system implementation in both private and public sectors in West Africa and have implemented over 80% of the successful ERP implementations in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Frontend Developer (React, Next.js, TypeScript)

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type:&nbsp;Full-Time

Job Summary


	Please make a brief statement regarding the important functions and responsibilities that comes with the job


Job Responsibilities


	Design and develop high-performance, responsive and accessible frontend applications.
	Work with the design and product teams to improve or establish the best and optimal User Interface Designs if required.
	Troubleshoot, debug and optimize frontend performance.
	&nbsp;Integrate RESTful APIs, third-party services and libraries.
	Guide, mentor and collaborate with junior developers.
	Utilize best practices and standards for coding, testingand deployment to ensure quality, security, and maintain ability.
	Design and implement code tests to ensure features are working correctly.
	Research and stay up-to-date with the latest trends in frontend development.
	Professional Certificates, licenses, and registrations that are required for this position


Requirements
Qualifications:


	B.Sc in Computer Science or Equivalent Competencies / skills for this position


Hard skills:


	React, Next.js, SCSS, TypeScript, Git, Redux, versioning.


Soft skills:


	Collaboration, mentor-ship, communication, innovation, time management.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@softalliance.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Frontend Developer (React, Next.js, TypeScript) Job at Soft Alliance




        
    

        
        Soft Alliance is a highly-driven organization, motivated to help businesses run efficient processes and deliver services effectively. For over sixteen (16) years, we have delivered high-end IT services to many organizations. Through our diverse experience and expertise, we have led the largest ERP system implementation in both private and public sectors in West Africa and have implemented over 80% of the successful ERP implementations in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Frontend Developer (React, Next.js, TypeScript)

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-Time

Job Summary
     

            
    




	Please make a brief statement regarding the important functions and responsibilities that comes with the job


Job Responsibilities


	Design and develop high-performance, responsive and accessible frontend applications.
	Work with the design and product teams to improve or establish the best and optimal User Interface Designs if required.
	Troubleshoot, debug and optimize frontend performance.
	 Integrate RESTful APIs, third-party services and libraries.
	Guide, mentor and collaborate with junior developers.
	Utilize best practices and standards for coding, testingand deployment to ensure quality, security, and maintain ability.
	Design and implement code tests to ensure features are working correctly.
	Research and stay up-to-date with the latest trends in frontend development.
	Professional Certificates, licenses, and registrations that are required for this position


Requirements
Qualifications:


	B.Sc in Computer Science or Equivalent Competencies / skills for this position


Hard skills:


	React, Next.js, SCSS, TypeScript, Git, Redux, versioning.


Soft skills:


	Collaboration, mentor-ship, communication, innovation, time management.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@softalliance.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Head, Human Capital Management",
  "description": "Bosak Microfinance Bank Limited was incorporated in December 2009 with the business objective of providing financial service to micro clients who were excluded from the mainstream financial system. It commenced operations in June 2010 upon obtaining a Unit Microfinance Banking License from the Central Bank of Nigeria. It later obtained a State Microfinance Banking License in 2016.&nbsp;Bosak Microfinance Bank Limited&rsquo;s financial inclusion effort focuses on promoting savings culture, access to credit facilities for income-generation purposes and reducing vulnerability to risk through micro insurance.

The Bank&rsquo;s major strategic focus employs the group lending methodology in its operations with a leaning towards women. It believes in the commitment of women folk to work hard and help their families conquer poverty. As such, more than 95% of the Bank&rsquo;s lending activities focuses on women. The success of the bank&rsquo;s group lending activities largely depends on group solidarity and cohesion. The success recorded by the bank in its lending program has earned it strategic partnership with the Bank of Industry (BOI) and the Development Bank of Nigeria (DBN) among others. The combination of cutting-edge technology, a strong and committed Board of Directors and motivated employees has helped the Bank to create a brand widely accepted by its teeming clients in Lagos. It is now expanding its frontiers in a scaling program aimed at delivering improved value to its stakeholders.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head, Human Capital Management
Job Location:&nbsp;Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
Strategic HR Leadership:


	Design and execute people strategies aligned with Bosak&rsquo; s values of simplicity, professionalism, and respect.
	Advise executive leadership on workforce planning, succession, and organizational design to support branch expansion and financial inclusion goals.
	Lead the development and enforcement of HR policies and processes in line with regulatory and ethical standards.


Talent Acquisition &amp; Retention:


	Oversee recruitment across business units, with emphasis on field-based roles such as loan officers and deposit mobilizers.
	Develop microfinance-specific talent pipelines and promote diversity and inclusion in hiring.
	Implement retention strategies including welfare programs, competitive remuneration, and employee engagement initiatives.


Learning &amp; Development:


	Identify industry-specific skill gaps and build training frameworks that emphasize credit risk, KYC, customer relations, and digital banking.
	Drive internal talent development through mentorship, coaching, and structured career paths.
	Promote continuous learning and development through training platforms and cross-functional exposure.


Performance Management:


	Establish and monitor KPIs that align employee output with institutional targets (e.g., loan repayment, deposit growth).
	Lead the annual performance appraisal process with an emphasis on fairness, feedback, and measurable development.
	Foster a high-performance culture through clear accountability and reward systems.


Compliance &amp; Risk Management:


	Ensure all HR practices are fully compliant with Nigerian labor laws, CBN regulations, and relevant microfinance standards.
	Maintain secure employee records, oversee payroll, and ensure data privacy in line with NDPR.
	Drive workplace discipline and risk mitigation through consistent enforcement of codes of conduct.
	Employee Engagement &amp; Organizational Culture
	Champion employee wellness, inclusion, and morale through structured programs and an open-door policy.
	Encourage a purpose-driven workplace culture centered on service to underserved communities.
	Manage conflict resolution, grievance redress, and change management initiatives with empathy and professionalism.


HR Operations &amp; Analytics:


	Supervise end-to-end HR operations including onboarding, off boarding, benefits administration, and policy reviews.
	Use data analytics to track turnover, training ROI, and productivity metrics to inform strategic decisions.
	Prepare and manage HR budgets, optimizing resource allocation without compromising staff welfare.


Qualifications and Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Human Resource Management, Business Administration, or related field.
	A recognized professional HR certification (e.g., CIPM, SHRM, and CIPD) is mandatory.
	Minimum of 7 years of post- NYSC HR experience, with 3 years in a managerial role within the financial or microfinance sector.
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian labor law, CBN regulatory requirements, and HR compliance procedures.
	Demonstrated success in recruitment, staff development, succession planning, and performance management.
	Excellent communication, leadership, and stakeholder management skills.
	Proficiency in HR information systems, Microsoft Office Suite, and payroll management platforms.
	A strong commitment to financial inclusion and working with grassroots communities.


Why Work with Bosak Microfinance Bank Limited?


	If you desire to work in an organization where employee motivation is key and passion is rewarded, then Bosak MFB might be the place for you.
	We are committed to building an open and rewarding work environment where all employees have equal opportunities for growth to realize their full potential.
	Our remuneration and employee welfare packages are among the best in the industry.


Benefits


	Comprehensive HMO
	Continuous Training and Development
	Leave and Passage allowance
	Opportunities for career growth in a mission-driven institution.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment@bosakmfb.com&nbsp;using &ldquo;Head, Human Capital Management&rdquo; as the subject of the mail.",
  "datePosted": "2025-08-25",
  "validThrough": "2025-09-26",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Bosak Microfinance Bank Ltd"
    
  },

Head, Human Capital Management Job at Bosak Microfinance Bank Limited




        
    

        
        Bosak Microfinance Bank Limited was incorporated in December 2009 with the business objective of providing financial service to micro clients who were excluded from the mainstream financial system. It commenced operations in June 2010 upon obtaining a Unit Microfinance Banking License from the Central Bank of Nigeria. It later obtained a State Microfinance Banking License in 2016. Bosak Microfinance Bank Limited’s financial inclusion effort focuses on promoting savings culture, access to credit facilities for income-generation purposes and reducing vulnerability to risk through micro insurance.
     

            
    



The Bank’s major strategic focus employs the group lending methodology in its operations with a leaning towards women. It believes in the commitment of women folk to work hard and help their families conquer poverty. As such, more than 95% of the Bank’s lending activities focuses on women. The success of the bank’s group lending activities largely depends on group solidarity and cohesion. The success recorded by the bank in its lending program has earned it strategic partnership with the Bank of Industry (BOI) and the Development Bank of Nigeria (DBN) among others. The combination of cutting-edge technology, a strong and committed Board of Directors and motivated employees has helped the Bank to create a brand widely accepted by its teeming clients in Lagos. It is now expanding its frontiers in a scaling program aimed at delivering improved value to its stakeholders.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Head, Human Capital Management
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
Strategic HR Leadership:


	Design and execute people strategies aligned with Bosak’ s values of simplicity, professionalism, and respect.
	Advise executive leadership on workforce planning, succession, and organizational design to support branch expansion and financial inclusion goals.
	Lead the development and enforcement of HR policies and processes in line with regulatory and ethical standards.


Talent Acquisition & Retention:


	Oversee recruitment across business units, with emphasis on field-based roles such as loan officers and deposit mobilizers.
	Develop microfinance-specific talent pipelines and promote diversity and inclusion in hiring.
	Implement retention strategies including welfare programs, competitive remuneration, and employee engagement initiatives.


Learning & Development:


	Identify industry-specific skill gaps and build training frameworks that emphasize credit risk, KYC, customer relations, and digital banking.
	Drive internal talent development through mentorship, coaching, and structured career paths.
	Promote continuous learning and development through training platforms and cross-functional exposure.


Performance Management:


	Establish and monitor KPIs that align employee output with institutional targets (e.g., loan repayment, deposit growth).
	Lead the annual performance appraisal process with an emphasis on fairness, feedback, and measurable development.
	Foster a high-performance culture through clear accountability and reward systems.


Compliance & Risk Management:


	Ensure all HR practices are fully compliant with Nigerian labor laws, CBN regulations, and relevant microfinance standards.
	Maintain secure employee records, oversee payroll, and ensure data privacy in line with NDPR.
	Drive workplace discipline and risk mitigation through consistent enforcement of codes of conduct.
	Employee Engagement & Organizational Culture
	Champion employee wellness, inclusion, and morale through structured programs and an open-door policy.
	Encourage a purpose-driven workplace culture centered on service to underserved communities.
	Manage conflict resolution, grievance redress, and change management initiatives with empathy and professionalism.


HR Operations & Analytics:


	Supervise end-to-end HR operations including onboarding, off boarding, benefits administration, and policy reviews.
	Use data analytics to track turnover, training ROI, and productivity metrics to inform strategic decisions.
	Prepare and manage HR budgets, optimizing resource allocation without compromising staff welfare.


Qualifications and Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Human Resource Management, Business Administration, or related field.
	A recognized professional HR certification (e.g., CIPM, SHRM, and CIPD) is mandatory.
	Minimum of 7 years of post- NYSC HR experience, with 3 years in a managerial role within the financial or microfinance sector.
	Strong knowledge of Nigerian labor law, CBN regulatory requirements, and HR compliance procedures.
	Demonstrated success in recruitment, staff development, succession planning, and performance management.
	Excellent communication, leadership, and stakeholder management skills.
	Proficiency in HR information systems, Microsoft Office Suite, and payroll management platforms.
	A strong commitment to financial inclusion and working with grassroots communities.


Why Work with Bosak Microfinance Bank Limited?


	If you desire to work in an organization where employee motivation is key and passion is rewarded, then Bosak MFB might be the place for you.
	We are committed to building an open and rewarding work environment where all employees have equal opportunities for growth to realize their full potential.
	Our remuneration and employee welfare packages are among the best in the industry.


Benefits


	Comprehensive HMO
	Continuous Training and Development
	Leave and Passage allowance
	Opportunities for career growth in a mission-driven institution.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@bosakmfb.com using “Head, Human Capital Management” as the subject of the mail.
